channel.title: Please help!
channel.description:
In the sticky post in server tuts "how to create a server" i did everything, but when i got to the part at end where it said "if your server isn't still up, try opening up your ports 43594 in firewall/router" well i went to my firewall overview and than to firewall, but i couldn't find 43594 port in the list that was populated. I need help, i did everything but my server still doesn't work because i think its because of the ports.
Other information: I have a firewall broadband router, and i use a access point for my computer only (the one that im trying to make the server with). Do i have to do something with the router? Because than ill have to change options, details in my other computer with the router connected, and i don't know anything about that.
Please help, Thanks[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 03, 2008, 02:43:02 pm[/size][hr]I need help, comon[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 03, 2008, 03:02:19 pm[/size][hr]plzz

item.title: Please help!
item.dc:creator: @fluster fluster
item.description:
@fluster wrote:

In the sticky post in server tuts “how to create a server” i did everything, but when i got to the part at end where it said “if your server isn’t still up, try opening up your ports 43594 in firewall/router” well i went to my firewall overview and than to firewall, but i couldn’t find 43594 port in the list that was populated. I need help, i did everything but my server still doesn’t work because i think its because of the ports.

Other information: I have a firewall broadband router, and i use a access point for my computer only (the one that im trying to make the server with). Do i have to do something with the router? Because than ill have to change options, details in my other computer with the router connected, and i don’t know anything about that.

Please help,
Thanks[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 03, 2008, 02:43:02 pm[/size][hr]I need help, comon[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 03, 2008, 03:02:19 pm[/size][hr]plzz
